client: Centre de services scolaire de Sorel-Tracy
verified_by: manual cross-reference (plans construction + devis + door schedule)
methodology: Cross-referenced 3 independent sources: (1) Construction floor plans (pages A-150, A-151), (2) Devis architecture door hardware groups (section 08 71 00), (3) Door schedule (page A-950). Each room confirmed by at least 2 sources.

numbering_scheme.description: Rooms use 3-digit IDs without block prefix on the plans. Block assignment is by number range.
numbering_scheme.note: The current GT uses A-xxx/B-xxx/C-xxx prefix format. The gold GT preserves this convention for compatibility but corrects the room numbers.

building_structure.note: No Bloc B 2nd floor. Rooms 200-216 are ALL Bloc A 2nd floor.

rooms_NOT_found.description: Room IDs from the current GT (emj.json) that do NOT exist on the architectural plans
rooms_NOT_found.explanation: The current GT incorrectly assumed each block uses its own 1xx numbering (B-101, C-101, etc.). In reality, the building uses a continuous numbering scheme: 100-123 (Bloc A), 127-145 (Bloc B), 146-151 (Bloc C), 200-216 (Bloc A 2e). There are NO rooms 103-107, 124-126, 128, 200, 201 in this building.

name_corrections.description: Rooms where the current GT has the wrong name

corrections.note: Name correct but was mislabeled in verification
Completely wrong - mechanical room, not a class
Not a corridor - it's a security vestibule with access control
